channel.title: CVE Feed for OpenImageIO Project -- OpenImageIO
channel.description: The latest CVEs for OpenImageIO Project -- OpenImageIO

item.title: CVE-2022-41999|2024-09-17T00:21:41.598Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the DDS native tile reading functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.3.19.0 and v2.4.4.2. A specially-crafted .dds can lead to denial of service. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-43595|2024-09-17T03:23:53.828Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: Multiple denial of service vulnerabilities exist in the image output closing functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. Specially crafted ImageOutput Objects can lead to multiple null pointer dereferences. An attacker can provide malicious multiple inputs to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability applies to writing .fits files.

item.title: CVE-2022-36354|2024-09-17T01:31:16.051Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: A heap out-of-bounds read vulnerability exists in the RLA format parser of OpenImageIO master-branch-9aeece7a and v2.3.19.0. More specifically, in the way run-length encoded byte spans are handled. A malformed RLA file can lead to an out-of-bounds read of heap metadata which can result in sensitive information leak. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-38143|2024-09-17T03:49:15.468Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the way OpenImageIO v2.3.19.0 processes RLE encoded BMP images. A specially-crafted bmp file can write to arbitrary out of bounds memory, which can lead to arbitrary code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-43594|2024-09-17T01:00:54.360Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: Multiple denial of service vulnerabilities exist in the image output closing functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. Specially crafted ImageOutput Objects can lead to multiple null pointer dereferences. An attacker can provide malicious multiple inputs to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability applies to writing .bmp files.

item.title: CVE-2022-43602|2024-09-17T03:42:36.442Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: Multiple code execution vulnerabilities exist in the IFFOutput::close() functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. A specially crafted ImageOutput Object can lead to a heap buffer overflow. An attacker can provide malicious input to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability arises when the `ymax` variable is set to 0xFFFF and `m_spec.format` is `TypeDesc::UINT8`

item.title: CVE-2022-41837|2024-09-17T02:36:43.135Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the OpenImageIO::add_exif_item_to_spec functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. Specially-crafted exif metadata can lead to stack-based memory corruption. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2022-43593|2024-09-17T03:22:41.471Z -- openimageio%20project -- openimageio
item.description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the DPXOutput::close() functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. A specially crafted ImageOutput Object can lead to null pointer dereference. An attacker can provide malicious input to trigger this vulnerability.
